result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie M Burk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie M Burk

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called briefly at 3:08 PM, recalled at 3:38pm {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Katie M Burk appeared by zoom from Sheboygan County Jail, in custody.    Attorney Francis P Raff appeared by zoom for Katie M Burk. Attorney Krysta Parson appeared by zoom from the courtroom for State of Wisconsin.

With leave of the Court, ADA Parson files an amended information; Atty Raff admits service and waives reading.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--any mental health evaluation and treatment recommended by DOC
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no contact with Victim 1 without written consent of Victim 1 and written permission of Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  0 days

Ms. Burk is to connect with Probation by 3:00pm tomorrow afternoon. 
recess: 4:00pm
w/ elements and ccs

Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/10) ML

Defendant Katie M Burk not in court.    Attorney Francis P Raff appeared via zoom for Katie M Burk. Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty Raff indicates that resolution has been reached; Ms. Burk is in custody at Sheboygan Co Jail. 

Scheduling is discussed.
recess: 2:56pm 
NEXT: Plea & Sentencing on 8/18/22 at 3:00pm via zoom

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 8:43am 
Defendant Katie M Burk in court, in custody, with Attorney Francis Raff. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Burk waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:48am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 13th at 10:00am,   (2) Status Conference on July 26th at 2:30pm
Francis Raff
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 2:05PM
Defendant Katie M Burk appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Parties waive Preliminary Hearing time limits.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and Victim/Witness Key (the Court allows the Defendant to return to the shared residence one time with the company of Law Enforcement to retrieve what is personally hers. If an item is in dispute, said item shall be left in the residence and be subject to the civil process).
--no acts or threats of violence
--not possess dangerous weapons

recess 2:11PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 06/21 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
